contentBlocks.title: Small Buildings Requirements
items: For buildings or sole-occupancy units with a floor area of less than 500 m², no specific energy monitoring requirements apply under J9D3.

contentBlocks.title: Medium Buildings Requirements Between 500 and 2500 m²
items: A building or sole-occupancy unit with a floor area of more than 500 m² must have energy meters configured to record the time-of-use consumption of gas and electricity.

contentBlocks.title: Large Buildings Requirements
items: A building with a floor area of more than 2 500 m² must have energy meters configured to enable individual time-of-use energy data recording, in accordance with (3), of:
air-conditioning plant including, where appropriate, heating plant, cooling plant and air handling fans
internal transport devices including lifts, escalators and moving walkways where there is more than one serving the building

contentBlocks.title: Communication System Requirements
items: Energy meters required by (2) must be interlinked by a communication system that collates the time-of-use energy data to a single interface monitoring system where it can be stored, analysed and reviewed.

contentBlocks.title: Exemptions
items: The provisions of (2) do not apply to energy meters serving:
a Class 2 building where the total floor area of the common areas is less than 500 m²
individual sole-occupancy units with a floor area of less than 2 500 m²
